possible interface for specifying fades: 1) draw a line from A to B with a region selected - that whole region will fade between colors from 100% at A to 100% other color at B 2) draw lines to segment a region into smaller regions - like, draw a line across the cat's leg (edge to edge) - apply full fill or fades to each segment - can set one end of fade to main color of region with auto-update if you refill the main region

collection view: - save collection as list of projects -- if a project is not saved already, prompt to save it first --- show scolling list of the thumbnails that don't save filenames, that user can set the filenames on -- save collection-level palette as full file? -- save collection-level palette as filename? -- don't save any collection-level palette info? - open collection from file - prompt to save collection on close if needed

thinking about file extension: ppp - Perpetual Paint Project - one image ppc - Perpetual Paint Collection - grouped images - Perpetual Paint Bitmap - one bitmap ---- could still be a ppp, just edited in Bitmap Mode instead of Outline Mode; and without a greyscale version; could be differentiated in the Config - Perpetual Paint Bitmap Collection - grouped bitmaps ---- could still be a ppc, again
collection view: - in secondary window - load multiple images/projects into the view - see grid layout of images

looking at System.IO.Packaging.ZipPackage -it does not compress - that's ok I just need grouping -there may be trouble for other zips to unzip this or for this to unzip another zipped file, but it sounds like it can always handle its own files so that's ok

applying color is pretty fast even on large image but removing the color is really slow

make a MasterImage class that one-time figures out all the regions in a background thread and provides that data to the color worker - A: finding 1 region at a time benchmarked at 10.7sec for tea shop cat - benchmarked at >15min for rabbit - B: leading edge method still >22min for rabbit and it was 10min for the cat (verified A still runs in 10sec on cat)
